mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Clarke, Henry Patient Age: 17. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Gun shot fracture of external and internal condyles of left arm. Wound severe. Location Wounded: Winchester, Va [Kernstown, Va]. Date Wounded: 1864/07/24. Nature of Wound: Musket ball. Treatment: Amputation of arm at middle third of humurus. Cold water dressings by irrigation: Eleven arteries ligated. Ligatures come away on the 8 and 9 days. Fungus from medulla protruded through posterior third of flaps. Escoriated and pressure. Applied with sweep.. Result: Discharged from service. Stump entirely healed and patient enjoying good health..
